name: Bacon and Puff Pastry Wrapped Asparagus
description: A fun and indulgent appetizer where asparagus is wrapped with spiral-cut puff pastry and bacon, baked to perfection, and served with a spicy mustard dipping sauce.
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon Sriracha or other chili sauce (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C) and line a baking tray with parchment paper.
Defrost the puff pastry and cut it into long thin strips to resemble spaghetti.
Snap the woody ends off the asparagus spears.
Wrap each asparagus spear with a strip of puff pastry in a spiral fashion.
Cut bacon slices in half lengthwise to make them thinner, then wrap each asparagus spear (already wrapped in pastry) with a strip of bacon.
Place wrapped asparagus on the prepared tray. Brush with beaten egg and season with black pepper.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until the pastry is golden and bacon is crisp.
While baking, mix mustard and chili sauce in a small bowl to make the dipping sauce.
Serve the asparagus warm with spicy mustard sauce on the side.
